item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR 4/02/2009 S4398; text as passed Senate: CR 4/02/2009 S4398; text of measure as introduced: CR 4/02/2009 S4387)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR 4/02/2009 S4398; text as passed Senate: CR 4/02/2009 S4398; text of measure as introduced: CR 4/02/2009 S4387)

summary.text:
Offers condolences to the victims, staff, and their families affected by the tragic events that occurred at the Pinelake Health and Rehab Center in Carthage, North Carolina, on March 29, 2009.

Honors the lives of Jerry Avant, Louise DeKler, Lillian Dunn, Tessie Garner, John Goldstrom, Bessie Hedrick, Margaret Johnson, and Jesse Musser, the deceased victims.

Recognizes the heroism of Officer Justin Garner.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Offers condolences to the victims, staff, and their families affected by the tragic events that occurred at the Pinelake Health and Rehab Center in Carthage, North Carolina, on March 29, 2009.

Honors the lives of Jerry Avant, Louise DeKler, Lillian Dunn, Tessie Garner, John Goldstrom, Bessie Hedrick, Margaret Johnson, and Jesse Musser, the deceased victims.

Recognizes the heroism of Officer Justin Garner.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the tragic events at the Pinelake Health and Rehab Center in Carthage, North Carolina on Sunday, March 29, 2009.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
